Read the following passage and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the passage:
Fish population is in serious danger from global warming. Climate change is increasing the water temperature in rivers, lakes and seas. This means there is less food and oxygen available for fish. It also means the fish may not grow fully and may have fewer offsprings. Some fishes will become extinct if temperatures rise even by one or two degrees celsius.
Climate change increases the pressure on fish population. Fishes are one of the world's most valuable biological assets. Forty percent of people in the world eat fish as their main source of protein. If we fail to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, we will increase the pressure on fish. As a result, people who depend on fish will suffer from hunger and poverty.

Question:
It is (a) — from the passage that global warming is (b) — great threat for fish population. (c) — global warming, food production and oxygen (d) — in water decrease. As a result, some fishes may be extinct (e) ——.

Read the following text and answer the questions.
Charles Babbage was an English mathematician. He was also a mechanical engineer who is well-known for originating the concept of computer. He was born on 26 December 1791 in London. He entered Trinity College in October 1810 . He was transferred to Peterhouse, Cambridge. He was the top mathematician there. He received an honorary degree without examination in 1814 . He was elected a fellow of the Royal University in 1816. Babbage is famous for inventing the first mechanical computer in 1822 that eventually led to today's computer. He died at his home in London on 18 October 1871.


Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Charles Babbage was an English mathematician and mechanical engineer, born on 26th December 1791 in London. He is widely recognized for originating the concept of the computer. Babbage entered Trinity College in 1810 and later transferred to Peterhouse, Cambridge, where he became the top mathematician. In 1814, he received an honorary degree and was elected a fellow of the Royal University in 1816. Babbage is most famous for inventing the first mechanical computer in 1822, which laid the foundation for the development of modern computers. He passed away in London on 18th October 1871.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Smart Phone' by answering the following questions:
a) What is a Smart Phone? b) What are the uses of it? c) What are the abuses of it? d) What are the effects of Smart Phone on human life? e) How can we control it?

sub_questions.explanation:
Smartphone
Smartphone refers to the mobile phone that has a touchscreen interface, an operating system capable of running different applications, the configuration of high-speed internet connection, and multimedia functions. The most common uses of smart phone are internet searching and web browsing. Other uses of smartphone are making phone call, listening to music, using social media apps, capturing and sharing photos and videos, etc. The effects of Smart phone on human life is huge. At present, there is hardly any person who doesn't have a smartphone. Smart phone has enabled' us to communicate with the people of the whole world in an instant. It has facilitated our life to a great extent. But alongside the huge number of benefits that we get from smart phone, it also brings about some troubles in our life. Access to huge number of data across the world through internet is a great threat to our creativity. It has also minimized our thirst for exploring the realm of knowledge that we are supposed to gain by participating physically in different expeditions. The smart phone has also expedited different kinds of cybercrimes. Many people, especially of young age, remain unnecessarily busy with browsing internet. Some people ate so obsessed in using internet that they behave in abnormal way. They cannot do much work in time due to wasting time in social media. To get rid of the abuses of smartphone, maintaining a strict schedule of work and increasing real life communication are effective ways. Besides, the parents should keep their children in close observation about their smart phone related activities. The government should adopt cybercrime law strictly to control abuses of smartphone. Thus, we all should control and be aware of the bad effects of smart phone.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Write at least ten new sentences to complete the story:
Once there lived a King in an island. There were green trees everywhere in the island. The King decided to build a magnificent palace in the island. So, he ordered his men to cut down all the trees. Some opposed the King's idea, but he did not pay……………….

sub_questions.explanation:
A King's Mistake
Once there lived a King in an island. There were green trees everywhere in the island. The King decided to build a magnificent palace in the island. So he ordered his men to cut down all the trees. Some opposed the King's idea but he did not pay any heed to them. All the trees, were cut, a palace was built and the King continued to live his day in pride inside the new shiny walls of his prized possession, It was only he who unconsciously and with folly kept living in the palace until he realized that his kingdom had begun to deteriorate. There was no rice in the granary, no fruit in the storehouse, no fish in the pond and no peace among the people. One afternoon, he took a step outside the palace and, for a second, mistook his green island for a barren land. The air was so uneomfortably warm that he even struggled to breathe. The common people outside his gate were watching him suffer in silence. With no delay, the King realized he had made a grave mistake and had lost his kingdom, his lands and his people. But it was not too late because he still had a little time left to fix his mistake. He couldn't but ask his people to help him save the island because he had now realized he was not the sole owner of it: The island belonged to everyone.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Sostika/Anu, and your friend's name is Tanzima/Khalid. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the severe impact of dengue fever.

sub_questions.explanation:
Sostika (Anu): Hey Tanzima, have you heard about the recent dengue outbreak in our area? It’s getting really serious!
Tanzima (Khalid): Yes, I’ve heard! My neighbor's cousin just got hospitalized with dengue fever. It's terrifying how quickly it spreads. What’s going on exactly?
Sostika (Anu): It’s caused by mosquitoes, right? They breed in stagnant water. Once a person is bitten, they can get a high fever, severe body aches, and even bleeding. It can be deadly if not treated in time.
Tanzima (Khalid): I read that hospitals are overwhelmed with patients, and the doctors are struggling to keep up. It’s so scary! Even young people are getting affected. I think it's spreading faster than last year.
Sostika (Anu): Yeah, it’s really alarming. The worst part is that there's no specific medicine for dengue. Treatment mainly focuses on relieving the symptoms, like reducing the fever and staying hydrated. It’s crucial to catch it early.
Tanzima (Khalid): That’s true. It’s affecting so many people in our community. I’ve seen people talking about how important it is to eliminate standing water around the house, like in old tires or containers, to prevent mosquito breeding.
Sostika (Anu): Exactly! Everyone should be extra careful about that. Mosquito nets and repellents can also help. The government and health organizations are doing their best, but we all need to take responsibility to stop the spread.
Tanzima (Khalid): We definitely need to spread awareness. People still don't take mosquito control seriously, but if we don’t, this will keep getting worse.
Sostika (Anu): True. We should tell everyone to clean up their surroundings, especially with the rains coming. Prevention is the key! Let’s spread the word in our neighborhood too.
Tanzima (Khalid): Yes, let’s do that! It’s up to all of us to stop dengue from spreading further. Stay safe, Anu!
Sostika (Anu): You too, Tanzima! Let’s stay vigilant and protect ourselves and others.
